description: A woman is depicted rolling dough with a rolling pin on a counter, seemingly unaware that a pair of reading glasses are pressed into the dough. In the background, a man holding a rolled-up newspaper urgently asks if his reading glasses have been seen. The scene presents an ironic juxtaposition between the man's search and the glasses' location, highlighting a common domestic frustration through an absurd visual gag. The glasses, embedded in the uncooked dough, represent the misplaced object being literally underfoot, or under rolling pin, all along.
caption: "Blast it, woman! ... Have you seen my reading glasses?"
